Radio Frequency Jammers are soo 20th Century.
India has developed a Non-Nuclear Directional Electromagnetic Pulse Generator that has a range of 12 KM(7.5 Miles) that fires 5 rapid pulses down the path of incoming Missiles, and their Launch Platforms.
The effect is that Electronics and Electricity ceases to exist instantly, in the Missile and the Launch Platform, be it a MANPAD, Tank, Helicopter, or Aircraft.
The first 2 just disable the Launch Platform forever, but do no harm to the crews, however the loss of propulsion and all electronics, in a Helicopter or Aircraft result in crashes, which will highly likely result in death of the crew.
Though not deployed yet, it will be a Standard Missile Defense System on all Russian, Indian and Chinese T-14 and T-15 Armata Armored Vehicles per Jane's Defense.
The "Armata" advertisements call it a "Directed Energy Weapon" but it is actually an "EMP Cannon".

context:
Ok, I'm a bit frustrated by superficial reporting from every MSM source on these downed drone stories.
WHERE'S THE  WRECKAGE?!  In this case the drone is said to have been a mere 1000 yds from our ship, so photo evidence should be a virtual arms length away.  Where's the photo?
In the case of our own downed drone, we say that it was shot down in international waters but we 'have not found anything' in the way of wreckage yet the Iranian navy has displayed dozens of pieces of the wreckage.  Could it be because the drone was downed in Iranian territory as they said, making access to the wreckage off limits?  Sloppy follow up reporting.  Homer reporting, too I suspect.

replies.context:
Or the MEU simply didn't care to waste the time and resources to scoop up trash out of the sea. There is presumably very little intelligence value to be gathered from analyzing the debris of such a rudimentary drone. Probably not worth the risk to life and limb to go after it.

Also the Marines and Sailors are not cameramen , nor can they just whip out their cellphone and capture any footage they like. They may or may not have had a 43XX with them on the float, and even so, it doesn't guarantee that they are invited to record every single thing that happens. I imagine that when a drone is being operated around a ship, presenting a threat, you'd want to keep all non-essential personnel off the deck.

Just because they don't have a video doesn't mean it didn't happen. Shooting down a cheap drone is not a precursor to some vast conspiracy.

Honestly, nothing personal intended in my reaction to what you say, but, what you are saying is lame reasoning.  There is a heated differing in accounts of conflict by these two sides, and only the Iranians have provided video and material evidence of their accounting.  When credibility is at stake, you provide evidence to back up your claim.
Again, why don't our media show just an ounce of curiosity and ask for evidence?  Suspicious.  That's how we made our way into an invasion of Iraq, and Vietnam, for that matter...

Most people, including the international community, have come to learn over the years to trust the credibility of the USA over Iran. 

The purpose of Iran's activities were clearly to make us look bad. You can't do so without filming, so they took the time to film. The purpose of our activities were to defend the airspace immediately around a ship operating freely in international waters. Filming the event was probably the last thing on their mind while they responded to the threat. No vast conspiracy there...

Iran also said it "helped" a UAE ship that was having "trouble", and then "detained" another OK ship supposedly involved in some sort of incident. That is far more suspicious than the US saying we downed a drone. Iran is actively testing our limits in the straight of hormuz. Why would it be so far fetched to believe that they were buzzing our ships in international waters with cheap unmanned drones, and we didnt care to film our response?

"Most people, including the international community, have come to learn over the years to trust the credibility of the USA over Iran. "
